summary: Polish is a Slavic language spoken mainly in Poland by around 40 million people. It's written using the Latin alphabet with some extra letters. Polish has a unique stress pattern and many palatal consonants. It developed from older forms and was influenced by languages like Latin, Italian, and German, borrowing words and grammar. Polish is also used in parts of Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Belarus, Ukraine, and some Eastern European countries due to historical reasons. Many people around the world speak Polish as their second language.
title: Polish language
